title: How Many Value Convergence Holdings Limited (HKG:821) Shares Have Insiders Sold, In The Last Year?
text:
We often see insiders buying up shares in companies that perform well over the long term. On the other hand, we'd be remiss not to mention that insider sales have been known to precede tough periods for a business. So we'll take a look at whether insiders have been buying or selling shares in Value Convergence Holdings Limited (HKG:821).

What Is Insider Buying?

It is perfectly legal for company insiders, including board members, to buy and sell stock in a company. However, most countries require that the company discloses such transactions to the market.

We don't think shareholders should simply follow insider transactions. But equally, we would consider it foolish to ignore insider transactions altogether. For example, a Columbia University study found that 'insiders are more likely to engage in open market purchases of their own company’s stock when the firm is about to reveal new agreements with customers and suppliers'.

The Last 12 Months Of Insider Transactions At Value Convergence Holdings

In the last twelve months, the biggest single sale by an insider was when the insider, Pang Ting, sold HK$36m worth of shares at a price of HK$0.57 per share. So what is clear is that an insider saw fit to sell at around the current price of HK$0.55. While insider selling is a negative, to us, it is more negative if the shares are sold at a lower price. Given that the sale took place at around current prices, it makes us a little cautious but is hardly a major concern. The only individual insider seller over the last year was Pang Ting.

Pang Ting sold a total of 100576923 shares over the year at an average price of HK$0.60. The chart below shows insider transactions (by individuals) over the last year. If you want to know exactly who sold, for how much, and when, simply click on the graph below!

Insider Ownership of Value Convergence Holdings

I like to look at how many shares insiders own in a company, to help inform my view of how aligned they are with insiders. We usually like to see fairly high levels of insider ownership. It's great to see that Value Convergence Holdings insiders own 42% of the company, worth about HK$288m. I like to see this level of insider ownership, because it increases the chances that management are thinking about the best interests of shareholders.

So What Do The Value Convergence Holdings Insider Transactions Indicate?

It doesn't really mean much that no insider has traded Value Convergence Holdings shares in the last quarter. It's great to see high levels of insider ownership, but looking back at the last year, we don't gain confidence from the Value Convergence Holdings insiders selling.
